div.p: APA Sample Paper. Note: This page reflects the latest version of the APA Publication Manual (i.e., APA 7), which released in October 2019. However, for headlines and other complex readings, headings are important, because they help readers determine the main points of each section in the research paper. In addition, if the heading implies coverage of a fairly extensive topic, it is better to divide it into several parts using subheadings.

By simply following these five simple tips, you’ll be able to write one research paper heading after another to make the main ideas of your research paper easier for your readers to navigate. In APA Style, the Introduction section never gets a heading and headings are not indicated by letters or numbers. For a brief paper, you may find that level 1 headings suffice.
